question: How do I log in?
answer:
Click here and then type in your email and password. Your password was set upon creating your account. If you need to reset it, click here and enter your email address.


If you need to create a new account, please visit https://www.cohley.com/creators

question: How do I change my password?
answer:
Click here if you do not remember your password. You will receive and email with a link to reset your password. Please check your spam folder if you cannot find the email.

If you would simply like to update your password, click on the drop down menu in the upper right hand corner and select "Change Password." Enter your old password and then you will be able to choose a new password.

question: How do I edit my profile?
answer: Click on the drop down menu in the upper right hand corner and select “Edit Profile” OR Click on the “Home” header and select “Edit Profile” button. Cohley requires a bit of first party data so that we can improve our brief recommendation logic including gender, age, and ethnicity.

question: What is the Medals program?
answer:
• The Medals Program on Cohley is a way in which Cohley's most active creators can be rewarded and brands can view your medal level. Your medal level is displayed right next to your name in the header. 

  • Increase your medal status by creating photo and video content for a variety of brands. 

  • There are 4 medal levels: 

    • Gold

    • Silver

    • Bronze

    • No Medal  

  • Click here to learn more about the program and how to improve your medal level.

question: How do connect my PayPal account to Cohley?
answer:
• If you are in a current live brief and have not been paid yet, you'll need to add your PayPal email by clicking the "update PayPal info" under your profile within the brief chats. This button will only appear if you've been moved to the completed tab within the brief.

  • If you are not currently in an active brief, no action is needed. You'll add your PayPal email next time you apply to a brief!

question: Why does my account say "Avg. Content Time: Late"?
answer: If you have sent content past the "Content Sent By" date or submitted your post link late past the "Content Live By" date your profile will say "Avg. Content Time: Late". We cannot change the status of your Avg. Content Time manually. The only way to change this status is to send content in early in your next brief! If you sent content 3 days late in one brief, to change your status to "Avg. Content Time: On Time" you will need to send content 3 days early in your next brief! If you send content 5 days early in your next brief your status will change to "Avg. Content Time: Early"

question: How do I work through the Facebook sync error message I’m receiving when I login?
answer:
• You will need an Instagram Business Account linked to a Facebook Page to continue as a Cohley Creator. 

  • Follow the below instructions to sync your Instagram account to Cohley:

    1. If you haven’t done so, follow these steps to attach your Instagram Business Account to a Facebook Page

    2. Login to Cohley and click “edit profile” in the upper right corner 

    3. Attach your Instagram account with Cohley by clicking on the message to sync with

question: How do I update the Instagram account in my Cohley profile?
answer:
If Cohley is already synced with your Meta account, navigate here to change the Instagram profile connected to your Facebook business page. If the wrong account is synced and you have participated or applied to an influencer brief, you will need to create a new Cohley account. 


If you go to your Cohley profile and it does not say that you have connected your Instagram account, follow the steps on the account page.

question: Do I need to connect my Instagram to be apart of Cohley?
answer: Cohley has a variety of brands requesting different assets and deliverables. As a creator, you may apply to work on visual asset or review briefs without an Instagram connection. However, if you want to apply to an Influencer brief, you must connect your Instagram account and Facebook business page per the Meta requirements so that Cohley can pull in your social metrics and top posts. This also ensures that the brand can track the performance of your post after you have completed the campaign.

question: Do I need to have a Facebook account to be apart of Cohley?
answer:
Cohley has a variety of brands requesting different assets and deliverables. As a creator, you may apply to work on visual asset or review briefs without a Meta connection. However, if you want to apply to an Influencer brief, you must connect your Instagram account and Facebook business page per the Meta requirements so that Cohley can pull in your social metrics and top posts. This also ensures that the brand can track the performance of your post after you have completed the campaign.


Need help? Find out how to convert your Instagram personal account to a business account: click here.

question: I synced the wrong Instagram account.
answer: Accidentally sync up the wrong Instagram account? No worries - you can easily update to the correct account via Facebook. Click here for instructions.

question: Why is my trending engagement number not what I think it should be?
answer: Trending engagement is a Cohley calculation that looks at your last 12 photos, reels, carousels, and stories. We sum the total interactions and divide it by the number of followers. This represents that % of your followers that engage, on average, with your posts.

question: How do I update my likes and followers on my Cohley profile?
answer: We partner with Instagram to collect this data from your account so it is not something we can change for you. Cohley automatically updates your account metrics every 5 days.

question: Where do I find briefs open for applications?
answer: Log into your account at connect.cohley.com, go to the “Briefs” tab and then click on “New Briefs”.

question: How will I know if a brand brief is a good fit for me?
answer:
Click on the brief's thumbnail and PLEASE make sure to read the entire brief. Here brands express their desires for the potential partnership and describe further details about the brief.

  • Check out the 'why we want this content' to see where they plan to use the content and who they want to work with

  • Read the deliverables to understand what you are expected to create

  • Read the do's and don'ts to understand a final checklist of what would be expected

question: How do I apply to a brief?
answer:
When you find a brief that you would like to apply to, click the 'Apply to brief' button. Simply follow the steps in the pop-up window and then click Submit to complete your application.

  • Before applying, make sure to read over the brief details for special steps the brand may want you to include in your application (i.e. product selection or listing qualifications). 
  • Go to the product page to see if there are any special sizing or color selections you can choose between so that you can add your selection
  • View the content examples they provide for what they like and they don't want. If the brand requests example content, add something that is similar. Don't just link to your instagram page!
  • NOTE: once you have submitted your application, it is final and cannot be edited!

question: How will I be compensated?
answer:
Each brief has specific compensation levels set by the brand. You can find this by either looking in the "Compensation" section of the brief's thumbnail or by clicking on the brief and looking under the "Compensation" section. 

  • Compensation detailed in the brief will show you the amount to expect after PayPal has taken out their processing fees.

  • Payment will come via PayPal. When applying to the brief, make sure your PayPal email is correct.

  • PayPal will send you a tax form at the end of the year if you hit the income threshold.

question: Brief Applications Disappearing from New Briefs Tab
answer: When a brief's application deadline has passed, the brief will no longer show up in the "new briefs" tab. If the brand wants to move forward with the partnership, they'll send you a brief chat and the brief will appear in your "active briefs" tab.

question: I confirmed my application with a brand then the brief disapeared.
answer:
Brands will often message a large pool of creators to confirm interest, then accept their final list based off who confirms. In this case, this was not a glitch and the brand reached their max of creators with which they can work.


Once you have been removed from a brief, you are no longer able to see the brief or past messages.


This resource linked below can provide additional information. 

https://mailchi.mp/9bae347f02d0/attending-sxsw-7963

question: How do I clear my brief notifications or stop "Check Your Messages" email?
answer:
• To get rid of any chat notifications that may still be lingering in a brief, simply click into the chat box. 

  • If it's a notification to complete a certain task, such as submit content, the notification will go away when you complete that action.

question: How do I send content for review?
answer:
• Go to the 'Active' briefs tab and select the specific brief that you would like to submit content to. 

  • On mobile or desktop, you will see a 'Send Content' button if you have been accepted to a campaign. 

    • For an Influencer partnership, you will see the button to link your post once your content has been approved and the brand has confirmed you may now submit.

  • Upload the content via mobile or desktop and press 'upload' for the files to sync to Cohley

  • An automated chat will be sent to the brand letting them know that your content is ready for review.

question: How do I send my post link?
answer:
• In an Influencer brief, you have two ways to submit your post after the video or images have been approved:

    • Link to your Video - choose this for IG Reels, YouTube Shorts, or TikTok videos
    • Link to your Post - choose this for IG stories and posts

  • Simply paste the URL and then select upload and you will get a confirmation email confirming that you have completed the brief.

question: How will I be notified if a brand accepts my application?
answer:
• You will receive an email from Cohley notifying you which brief you are accepted into. 

  • You can also check on Cohley by clicking on the "Briefs" tab, and in the Active Briefs it will show the status of the brief as "Accepted" on the thumbnail.

  • You will not receive a notification if you are not accepted to a brief.

question: How will I be notified when I complete a brief?
answer:
• You will get an email confirming that you have completed the brief. 

  • You can also check on Cohley by going to the "Briefs" tab, and in Active briefs it will show the status of the brief as "Completed" on the thumbnail.

    • Review briefs will automatically be moved to your Completed brief section as you are not awaiting payment.

question: I have a question for the brand about the brief
answer: Sorry for any confusion. Any brief communication will need to take place directly within brief chats with the brand. We cannot answer on behalf of the brand who is managing the partnership. Please send a message to the brand directly within your brief.

question: I am late to submit content but not received product yet.
answer: If the brand has already granted you a content extension or you have not received product yet - you're all set! You will NOT be penalized for late content if you received product late or the brand granted you an individual content extension. If that is the case, you can ignore any automated emails about overdue content.

question: I cannot see a brief in my dashboard anymore.
answer:
If you can not see the brief in your dashboard you may have been removed from the brief or it has closed. This could be due to a multitude of reasons including budget constraints or other creators may have responded before you. 


Even if a brand messaged you to confirm your interest, they still may not have chosen to move forward with your application. You will only be accepted in a brief if you received an email and the banner over the brief says "Accepted". If the banner over the brief says "Applied" you have not been accepted.


Our best advice is to respond to the brands within 2 business days!

question: Why have some of my past briefs disappeared?
answer: The reason some of these briefs have disappeared is the brand no longer has an active account on the platform. Unfortunately, when the brand deactivates their account we can no longer show the brief in the platform.

question: Why did the brand accept more content than required?
answer: The number of assets you submit to a brief is at the creator's discretion. If you would like to be paid for additional content that was not required in the brief, we recommend reaching out to the brand directly in the brief to negotiate those extra assets.

question: Why am I receiving a 'content is due' email?
answer:
The following emails are automatically sent to you if you have not submitted content or provided the link to your post in an Influencer brief. This is to ensure everyone is logging into Cohley, checking messages, and aware of deadlines. 

  1. Content due to {{campaign.brand.name}} in 5 days
    1. This email is sent to any creator daily at 2pm that is part of a brief five days before the content submitted by date, that has not yet submitted content.
  2. Upload your content now for {{campaign.brand.name}}
    1. This email is sent to any creator daily at 2pm that is part of a brief the day of the content submitted by date, that has not yet submitted content. 
  3. WARNING: Content is late for {{campaign.brand.name}}
    1. This email is sent to any creator daily at 2pm that is part of a brief 2 days after the content submitted by date, that has not yet submitted content. 

For an influencer brief, if you are awaiting the brand's approval to post, you may ignore this email!

question: How will I get paid for my work if I’ve completed a paid brief?
answer:
• Brands have 30 days from the "content live by" date to pay you

  • Brands pay you directly using PayPal and Cohley does not take any cut of your compensation.

  • PayPal charges a 3.49% + $0.30 processing fee. This fee is reflected in the compensation section of your brief, depending on whether or not the brand has chosen to pay that fee on your behalf.

question: Don't have a PayPal account?
answer: • Creating an account is easy. Click here to sign up for free.

question: How do I know when a brand has paid me?
answer: You will get a notification and email once a brand has paid you. In addition, in the chat located in the specific brief, there will be the specific time stamp when the brand paid you.

question: Can I negotiate compensation?
answer:
All compensation negotiations will need to happen directly in the brief with the brand. The brand is directly choosing who to accept to their brief and deciding whether or not to negotiate rates with applicants. If the brand is interested in starting a conversation, they’ll reach out to you directly within the brief.
 
Please keep in mind that many creators are applying to the brief and willing to work with the rates listed in the brief. Negotiating rates decreases your chances of getting accepted.

question: Why is the PayPal fee charged to the creator?
answer: Paypal charges a 3.49% + $0.30 transaction fee every time a brand pays you. Each time a brand creates a new brief, they have the option to cover this fee for every creator. The total compensation you will receive is reflected in the brief's overview.

question: Do I need to file any tax form for Cohley payments?
answer:
If you require a 1099-K for Cohley payments, you would need to receive the form from PayPal. Cohley does not give 1099 forms to creators.


We DO NOT have visibility on how much you have earned from Cohley briefs, please review your PayPal transaction history to access this information!

question: Verify PayPal
answer:
We know you work hard on your paid brand collaborations, so we want to make sure you get properly paid. Making sure your Paypal account is verified will avoid any unnecessary delays in payment!


What will happen if my PayPal account isn't verified?

Verifying your PayPal account helps make PayPal even safer for everyone. If your PayPal account isn't verified, your Cohley brief payments will be unable to process. Payments will be returned, causing a headache for you and the brand to track down repayments.


How do I check if my PayPal is verified?

Log into your PayPal account, click this link! If you see the message like the screenshot below, you are NOT verified!
You must successfully link a bank account to your PayPal to be verified! 




How do I verify my PayPal account?

Log into your PayPal account, click this link and follow the instruction on the screen!
Once your account is successfully verified, when you click this link you should see the below message!

question: I was not paid for the correct tier based on my follower count.
answer:
Payment is based on your follower count when you apply to a brief. We auto track your follow count and store that information so it's not lost once you've applied. Then, when payment is sent we refer the the database that holds all the info on the follower count of the user.


At this time, we only have your Instagram follower count. If the brand agrees to pay you based on your TikTok follower count, you will need to request that via the chat and they will have to manually update the payment amount before submitting payment.

question: Why was I paid in the wrong payment tier?
answer:
Payments are automatically cross referenced with the amount of Instagram followers on your Cohley profile at the time you applied to a brief. 


If you have gained more followers since applying to a brief, the payment amount will be based on the follower count on your Cohley profile at that time. 

This allows our system to track your follower count and also allows brands to accurately know their budget within the brief.

question: Why is my payment on hold from Paypal?
answer:
You are likely a new Paypal user or have set up your Paypal account or transaction as a business that sells physical products. Paypal may require that the payer takes extra action to confirm product shipment in order to release payment immediately. 


If you receive a notification from Paypal inquiring about the transaction, like below, select SERVICE OR VIRTUAL PRODUCT to avoid having your payment put on hold. (DO NOT select Product.) 


Regardless of the reason Paypal has your payment on hold, funds should be released by Paypal within 20 days. If you have any issues, please contact Paypal customer support.

question: Cohley Work
answer: As a creator that has completed a brief with an uploaded image or video, the accepted the content will appear for brands when viewing your profile. Each piece of content is tagged with the type of brief (review, influencer, UGC, or professional).

question: Your Details
answer: Cohley has built a robust profile so that brands can quickly get to know you. Today, they can quickly filter by your location, age, and gender to help find the best matches amongst all applicants. In the future they will be able to filter by other aspects of your profile such as whether or not you have pets or kids. We also use this data to send you emails when brands are looking for more creators to apply - like creators with birds or men with beards! Thanks for keeping this information up to date as it will ensure you are matched for briefs for which you qualify.

question: Accounts
answer: As a creator, you can add links to your Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and other sites such as your professional website or canva portfolio. All links are quickly accessible from your application so that brands can see more of the content you create.

question: Social Profile and Social Metrics
answer: Today, Cohley only integrates with Instagram. Your Social profile and Social metrics are pulled in if you have authorized us to get this data from Meta. Here, brands running an influencer brief are most concerned about your followers and engagement rate, but also want to see what else you post about to determine if your influence is in line with their brands aesthetic. Cohley automatically updates your metrics every 5 days.

question: My Portfolio
answer: Cohley has launched a new way for you to highlight your work to brands via a portfolio specific to Cohley. This is the first thing a brand sees when viewing your application to a brief. Each portfolio can include 9 assets and can be a mix of photos and videos of landscape or portrait orientation. These must be files uploaded from your device and cannot be a link to a site. If you don't have 9 assets showcasing your talent, that's okay! You can grow your portfolio through Cohley work! You just need at least 1 file uploaded in order to apply to a review or UGC brief.

question: Leaving a review as part of a brief
answer:
If you've been accepted into a review brief, congratulations! Once you receive the product to review, educate yourself. Read the box, go to the website, familiarize yourself with the ingredients, etc.. Most imporantly, read the brief overview to understand what you should and should not say in the review. 


Cohley requires a star rating, a minimum of 50 characters, and a title in order to submit a review. We love it when Cohley creators also include a photo or a video - you are a creator after all! 


Depending on the brief, you will either be asked to leave your review in Cohley or also leave it on another website (chewy, sephora, ulta, etc.). Simply follow the prompts and we will direct you there. Most importantly, take a screenshot of that confirmation and come back to Cohley to attach your proof of review in order to submit.

question: Why am I being asked a question before I can see the brief?
answer:
We know you want into this brief - but you can't cheat and fib telling us Yes to a question just because you want to get accepted. Because some people were not telling the truth in order to apply, we have changed the order so that you can't read the right answer in the brief before applying. Brands have these questions in place for a reason. They want to work with the best creators for their brand. Just like you want to make sure you're a good fit for the brand, they want to make sure you're a good fit for them. Be honest. There is a brief for everyone! 


And if they ask for a photo to include, make sure it's relevant to the question at hand!

question: I'm not seeing as many briefs as I used to. Did something happen?
answer:
I think you're catching on to something! We're excited to inform you that brands now have the ability to target briefs to specific demographics, such as country, age, and gender. We want to emphasize that this feature is not about discrimination; it's about creating the best possible outcomes for everyone involved. There are situations where this kind of targeting can be incredibly beneficial.


Brands will use this level of targeting if they physically can't ship outside the United States. If their product is only for men and they want a true video testimonial. Or if the creator needs to be of a certain age in order to use the product.


Our best solution? Make sure your profile is complete. Otherwise, you are omitted right from the start!

question: TikTok vs Instagram briefs
answer:
Looking at a new Influencer brief? You might notice that brands are now selecting the platform for which they are looking for creators to post. This will ensure you have authorized the correct platform, they are looking at the correct social platform, audience, and engagement metrics, and you are paid for the correct follower count. Once we have the authorization ready for you, you will also be able to easily add a TikTok just like you do an Instagram post today.


And other good news...we will be adding Reels data! Stay tuned for more updates!
